There is this quote, unfortunately I don't remember by whom: "When the world around us falls silent, it becomes all the louder within us" ....
I think the world can still be so seductive with all its gadgets and its possibilities of procrastination. I think one is well advised to listen to oneself from time to time ... The world around us seems to prove it right

Like you, my consciousness constantly reminds me all the things I need to do, but not the small things, but the things I need to do the achieve greater goals like being more successful in certain domains. Also, I noticed that at night, when a conversation I had during didn't go well, my mind will replay the scene in a loop, until I say the things I should have in that conservation to make it a good one.

Right now, I'm at work, listening to music, my manager has a football game on the TV behind me... So when I drive home, it's very likely I'll drive home in silence. It's taken me a while to appreciate the wisdom in this, but you're right: even if I am alone with my thoughts, it doesn't mean I have to blindly accept everything "Bruno" has to say. (Luca reference, for those unaware.) However, I've also learned sometimes Bruno does have wisdom to share, things I missed throughout the day, and if I'm drowning him out, who knows what I'd end up passing over!
I do that too! (Replay conversations/interactions that didn't go well)
